page.title: 08FAMILY ROOTS IN CROSTON
page.content: The village is made up of{long {established families}of 3 or 4 generations and{newcomers}of less than 25years.Some of the established families tend to live in older terraced property originally rented, although many of these houses have been bought by newly married couples as the older generation dies.Others are{farmers}whose houses are over four generations old. Between 15 and 20 years ago there was a{rapid housing expansion}in the village and many new houses were built.This attracted people fron urban areas who{commute}to their work. {Young people}from established families, not attending university, tend to marry and settle in the village or one of the neighbouring villages.
